title: Frame by Frame - What are you Looking For?
text:
You have given up before, yet you continue to dream, and sometimes have a look on CL. 
You know nothing is going to happen, no one is going to appear that will make you feel like you are not really different than all others. 
Perhaps you have or have had some physical issue (i.e. cancer, a broken something, etc., the potential list goes on endlessly) and/or spent time feeling so alone that even with therapy and perhaps an anti-depressant, the path seems solo in nature. 
It wasn't always this way for you. 
But when you think about it, and you have, you realize that you haven't always been the person that you are now.
And, that all of the years that passed, during which your goal was to make other people happy, did not make you happy. 
You have not been the only person on this earth to feel this way, to be wired in this way, to not be comfortable alone or surrounded by most others. 
But of course, some people like you find others. 
And, some never do. 
So, day after day, you get up, go through the routine you have in place...and then give some thought to the creative paths that seem to hold value for you: reading, writing, drawing, music...the list seems endless. 
Some days you create something, some days you don't. 
Some days you feel OK, and nothing seems to matter much. 
Some days you wish that perhaps when you go to sleep that night, you would not wake up, though only because of some higher power, nothing to do with your choices. 
So, what now? 
What if you simply find someone, and without looking for them to fix or change anything you are going through, share with them. 
What if you simply find someone, and without looking to fix them or change them in any way, allow them to share with you.
What if you put aside what you think you want, and the check list you normally use in looking for someone, and simply allow the exchange to happen without any diminishing feelings in any direction. 
What if you do this online until your perception changes, fear subsides, or until the exchange is uncomfortable and you get to stop without fear.
What if you choose to share yourself and your thoughts, ideas, writing, drawing, music, etc., without many questions being written in either direction. 
What if you realize that without the effort, you are likely to be alone forever, mentally anyway. 
Which, of course, may be fine. 
But what if life can be more interesting when someone is found that accepts the person we really are inside.
But what if life can often be more interesting when we find someone different than we are, and learn to accept them with the interesting, unharmful, and unique values that they have inside them, if they do have them.
You may have noticed, that the question marks that are patterned to follow "what if" in a sentence are not present.
Perhaps removing the question marks, in the way we share, is the best way to share. 
Write or wrong. (No misspelling...) It's your choice to do what you choose to do. Be comfortable. Make choices. And realize that there is a value in not simply walking into the closet in which you were born, and shutting the door behind you. 
This was not written for many to understand. 
But if you do understand, you are not alone, regardless of what you decide. 
Enjoy the day. Write if you like. Don't if you don't.

title: Are you...
text:
Are you wired differently? 

Your thoughts are not the same as most people around you? 

You have dated, perhaps been married, but after a while, you find that you are no longer happy. 

A voracious reader? Perhaps a consistent writer? Undoubtedly an unstoppable thinker? 

Yet, over and over, you find yourself alone, wondering what exactly is different about you?

If you would like to share your thoughts, I would like to read them and share mine.

I don't think I am alone in this perception, but finding those who share the experience is often difficult.

Perhaps it is for you too...

title: To be happy, don't ever change! Never!
text:
Okay, okay, okay...

I know that no one wants to read this, but I will write it anyway.

I can't take it. I want it to change!

Some women write interestingly for a short time, then the boring, questionable, patterned words begin. Start one way, then continue another. Put forth practiced introductory thoughts and ideas, then switch to routine daily thoughts and ideas, which rarely change over time. Respond emotionally to the thoughts and ideas you read, but don't put forth any of your own.

Why not, I ask? Don't you really have any thoughts and ideas that are yours personally?

Just alone at the moment and bored? Never had a relationship that involved any type of non-physical exchanges? Never have seen value in reading, writing, exchanging? Never exchanged without judging first, as you put no value into the desire to express anything of significance anyway? 

So you are not looking for any type of change in the way you live? You are not looking for anything less than the pattern you were taught to follow? And, this has made you so happy up until this point, that you want to continue the approach? 

Oh, I get it. I am so sorry! You know that I am only kidding! I want you to continue to be happy with your past and its repetition into your future. I'll quit writing that other silly stuff!

So, tell me again all the troubling things that you experienced today. Oh yes, then tell me that you hope things will go better tomorrow. Tell me about your troubling past in which no changes were thought of or attempted. Tell me about your old husband/boyfriend, you know, the terrible guy who didn't treat you like you deserve to be treated. Tell me how you want to meet a guy who will take care of you, and put your life back on its track to be repeated once again. 

I guess, finding that codependent man with only a physical interest in you will make it work out better for you during this round of repetition? Won't it? 

So write to me, and explain to me how getting your next relationship going and over quickly is going to finally make you happy. 

What? You don't believe me? What is it that you have the desire to share that would allow me to have a vision of what you do believe? Hmmm? Laugh, I will now shake my head and smile. Maybe you will too?

title: Ignorance Lost, Thoughts Shared
text:
You might say that I am looking to regain the ignorance of youth that I have lost. The ignorance that once burned brightly, but that time and experience has seemed to all but extinguish. 

Perhaps we are all just creatures of habit, and once habits are set, we are more interchangeable than I would like to believe. 

Repeating the same actions and expecting the same results would be one thing, but I tend to think that Freud was right... when you set out to write a new story by using the same plot and characters as the last ... well ...expecting it to turn out differently might not put your picture in the dictionary next to the word "sane", assuming you use a dictionary with pictures... 

I am looking for a woman who spends too much time stuck in her head, has enough history to want to live outside of it, and realizes the difference between patterns that make sure that the kids get fed and the bills get paid, and patterns that keep us questioning, learning, and listening. I think words and ideas are exciting, and belong in the same world as that of touch and kiss. 

If you choose to write, do so with intention, and then share. Keep in mind that what is shared holds more value than how it's written. Your ability to write is not as important as your ability to think. Simply write and share, without worry about being judged negatively. 

How would it feel to put thoughts and ideas into words and then share with someone who simply takes them in, smiles, and shares thoughts and ideas back? It's a great big world so make your mark, assuming you have a mark to make! You don't really have to spend your entire life alone inside your head, do you? 

What have you got to lose? And if you know the answer, simply share it and see how that feels. You may be surprised.

title: so men and women can or cannot be friends????
text:
So can anyone answer this question??? Is it truly impossible for two people of the opposite sex to be friends? Why must women seek out gay males for that? And why can't us men truly enjoy the art of the conversation with whoever? Let's be honest, if my wife saw me at a table, even at work with a complete hottie; being her friend would be completely unacceptable. On the flip side, for you women who say " maybe she's not secure in herself", if u saw your husband talking in the same scenario day in aand day out you would f-ing flip or at least question the situation until it stopped.

Yes, guys are the same . we'd also question the hell out of the reversed situation. The sad part is I used to have tons of friends both male and female. As life has moved on, those female friends have been replaced by more male friends. It just made it easier at home!!

So I pose this question: for those of you even capable of being honest with yourself........ How would the "friendship" scenario I threw out there work in your world? Would you question your other halfs conversation time with her??? I know u would so I guess the real question is why?????

Why cant adult men and women (especially married ones) have a friendship??? Phone chats, coffee, workout stuff etc etc. You know, the same stuff I do with my male friends daily.

title: Wanted: Maternal & Open-Minded Friend to Talk to
text:
Hey y'all. Spring is on its way, and quickly.

Dealing with a lot lately, and much of it all at once. Trying to juggle multiple things and mutli-task. Something that I've never really quite mastered. I've lost a lot of confidence in myself as of late when it comes to women. I've had a lot of failed relationships and it's left me questioning my self-worth, and what I'm worth to someone else. I feel somewhat abandoned in life, and just want someone that has a caring and warm heart to talk to. I live a very unique life that seems to turn many away without giving it the "old college try."

I live and cope with Severe Depressive Disorder from both genetic inheritance, and from emotional abuse (bullying). I also cope with having Anxiety, and High Functioning Autism. That said, I feel pretty regressed emotionally. It leaves me feeling awkward and identifying as younger than I really am. For health reasons, I live what's called "straight-edge" meaning that I don't drink, smoke, or do drugs.

I just feel very alone and need someone that I can call a good friend; one that I can trust to be there, and never hurt, betray, or abandon me. 

Please be non-judgmental and open to alternative lifestyles, and perhaps someone "kink-friendly" or at least understanding that I wear diapers. I have a lifestyle that might not be "friendly" to some. Nothing illegal....just unique and often misunderstood, or misinterpreted. If curious, please ask for more information.

title: Any Gardeners Looking for a Garden?
text: I am optimistic that spring is coming. My husband and I have a home in the northern St Paul suburbs with over an acre of land on a lake. I like to garden, my partner not so much, and so it falls to me to maintain the landscape. We have a service for the lawn but it is still a lot of work in the rest of the yard, especially now in the spring. We used to have a friend who lived in an apartment who would come over to help because he missed the chance to be outdoors and work with the soil but he moved out of state. So if you are living somewhere where you can't garden and would like to come out to relax and garden, we'd like to hear from you. Pruning, weeding, dividing, planting. Also opportunities to swim, canoe and fish while you are here. Half the garden is a woodland garden, the other half has more sun. Mainly have perennials. Would be open to giving you some space of your own if there is something in particular you would like to grow. Deer, however, can be an issue. We are in our very early 60's but are open to any age. Platonic only.

title: I Believe I Know Nothing
text:
I practice believing I know nothing, more precisely. That doesn't mean I lack knowledge, or flick matches at my grey matter hoping to ignite a forest fire. I'm referring to the bigger picture, the larger questions we have in life, and my rejection of the human tendency to concoct bullshit explanations and believe them.

If that makes sense and you're intrigued and/or practice life similarly, call me. Wait, I jumped the gun, sorry.

You probably have a good idea already whether you and I are the elements for a blossoming friendship to be, but I should probably divulge more about myself, my interests, and what I'm looking for just in case ;).

I'm single, 37, and have no children. I have no skeletons in the closet; I don't even have a closet. I'm not interested in meeting married folks, unless you and your partner have a real trust and understanding with each other. I don't need any jealous husbands or wives looking to juice me (OJ). I'm tactfully honest, open, and forthcoming, and have no interest in meeting those who are deceptive, secretive, or even private to an unhealthy degree. Oh, and habitual naysayers should click their back buttons immediately and consider locking yourselves indoors for good. Think porn, lots of porn.

I'm truly looking for friendship first and foremost, and not partners, sexual or relationship-wise. I am not opposed to the possibilities nor will I deny any attraction, but it's not my intent. Don't mistake me, I fully appreciate and embrace my animalistic qualities, but I'm led by what's above my belt-line. I'm seeking female friendship for that very reason as most men are not, and I can't relate. And, at this juncture I could use more feminine perspective.

My first love is laughter. I find no greater pleasure than laughing with others to tears. My ideal death would be from a shortness of breath in the midst of an uncontrollable guttural laugh. Likewise, I'm a character and a comic at heart, and much of my creativity comes in comedic form. I love to make people laugh. I write comedy to entertain myself.

I appreciate many forms of art, but especially music and theater. I enjoy a full spectrum of musical tastes, like Metal, Opera, Electronic, Ambient, and plenty more. Jazz and the Blues generally make me cringe. I'm on a massive Power Metal kick at the moment. When driving alone, I crank it up and do my best to hit the high notes. 

Here are some other tidbits, rants, whatever you want to call them about myself to help paint the picture:

- While I love comedy, what I'm actually best at is generating ideas in general
- What I'm worst at is listening when I take no interest in the subject
- I'm a humanitarian at heart who regularly takes exception with humanity
- I'm somewhat of a loner since most of my friends moved far away to Facebook, and visiting would be costly
- For money, I'm a web application developer. I enjoy it enough, but I would happily torch my meal ticket if the internet died tomorrow. I know too much, and it's a fucking mess 
- Watching movies triggers a narcoleptic reaction in me, and I'm rarely interested. Personally, finding the diamonds in the rough soaks the life out of me and isn't worth the effort. My favorite movie is Kingpin and if you find that more laughable than the movie itself, watch it 100 more times
- I watch little television, but on occasion do find a series that's intriguing. The writers of Orphan Black stole the plot from my brain, I'm not sure how. . .
- I enjoy reading books that challenge me to expand. Recently, I've read or am reading World Wide Mind, Falling Into Grace, The Elegant Universe, and Meditations
- Religious I am not (surprise, surprise), and while I can't understand, I am not immediately intolerant of those who are. I know some incredibly altruistic religious folks
- Atheism, I am completely intolerant of
- If Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton are elected president, I'm going to become a thrill seeker and put myself at great, personal risk. Then again, I said the same thing over the possibilities of Bush, Obama, or Romney getting the nomination over the years. . .
- I enjoy the indoors and outdoors equally, typically doing indoors and being outdoors. I enjoy being physical and love to bike, hike, blade, skate, and much more. I just started getting into yoga again, and welcome the challenge
- I eat well, and enjoy quality, diverse cuisine. Now that McDonald's serves breakfast all day, I'm set. Well, occasionally I stray for sushi, curry, and Italian. And Thai. And Russian. I hate McDonald's.
- I enjoy drinking coffee, tea, and wine. I rarely drink alcohol to excess, but do have a drink or two occasionally

Ideally, I'm looking to get up and out of the house more often and meet interesting, new people. While I greatly appreciate the art of writing, I'm not really looking for pen pals. Certainly, text-based correspondence is to be expected in the beginning. I fully understand that you are a woman, replying to a man, on Craigslist.

Time to go play now, good day!

title: 37 Year Old Single Biker with a BIG heart and a lot of time!
text:
Hope you are having a great day! Being incarcerated isn't all bad, especially if I hear from you it would be a lot better! I am incarcerated at a minimum security prison in South Dakota and am looking for a pen pal with a positive attitude. 
I have always been self-employed, my interests (outside of work) revolve around my three children and riding motorcycles. I live the motorcycle lifestyle 24/7 (except when I got sent to jail LOL). . .I am not just a weekend warrior! My life is an open book, if you want to know ANYTHING about me just ask. Right now I'm just looking for a pen pal, but a relationship is definitely a possibility. Relationships take time and I have lots of that since my release date is Feb 2019. 
I have lead a very interesting life and if you contact me I promise you will find my (pre prison) life quite entertaining and will also find that I am a fun loving genuine guy. . .. . .most say I am a teddy bear (with tattoos LOL)
I am currently in South Dakota (where I spent most of my life), but I find the thought of relocating appealing so don't worry about where you are living. I'm looking at all my options and am very excited to get my life back on track and also look forward to hearing from you. This is my first time in jail and am very clear that I am not coming back and realize that I need to make changes in my life to assure that won't happen again.
So if any of this sounds interesting to you, send me a letter and make sure you address it exactly the way I have written it (including your return address with your full name) otherwise I won't receive it (another one of those "jailhouse" rules). Some other details about me: Height 5'9", Weight 250, Eye: Brown, and Hair: Brown/Gray, muscular.
PS One more thing, I am open minded when it comes to age (over 21 please), race or body type but please just have a great sense of humor and a positive attitude! If you can include a photo with your letter I would appreciate that! I can forward a photo to you of me . . ...just ask!
I look forward to hearing from you!
William Waldner # 36455
Yankton Community Work Center
178 Mickelson Dr.
Yankton, SD 57078

title: Ladies, have you ever heard or seen anything like this?
text:
Ladies, I am not looking to offend anyone here. I am just really trying to figure something out.

I am a married male and not looking for anything other than to talk. I truly hope one woman will take the time to talk.

So, here is my question. Last night my wife and I went out. We had dinner, some wine and a great time. On the way home she told me she wanted to try something different and asked me if I was open to it. I asked her what it was but said it was a surprise and asked me if I was open to trying. When we got home, she asked me to trust her. She asked me to take a shower and to completely shave all the hair off my body. All of it. I did as I was told. When I was done, she told me to put lotion on my body. I did this. She then called me into the bedroom. When I got it there I noticed a bra, panty and garter belt set with nylons and heels on the floor. She helped me put it all on. I was intrigued as to where this was going. So I put it all on. When I was done, she called me into the bathroom. She told me to sit on her bench. I did that and she proceeded to put makeup on me. When she was done, she said there was one thing missing. She then put a really long blond wig on me. 

She took me to the living room and we shared a glass of wine. She then came over and started to kiss me. She told me she loved me dressed like that and loved being able to make love to her girly husband. We had a great time with normal sex. It was pretty amazing as she was really turned on. 

When it was over, she got up and got a bag out of the closet. It had pink panties and a pink teddy. She told me she wanted me to put it on. I crawled into bed and she snuggled with me all night. She said it felt sexy and she loved the way I look and felt.

My question to the open person out here is why did this turn her on? Are there other women out there like this? What is it about it that excites them or her? I am truly just trying to figure this out. Will anyone talk to me please?

title: Need nurturing connections?
text:
There is something about an affectionate, nurturing, spiritual human being who lights up the room and immediately makes you feel comfortable and is a very loving person toward others. This is somebody who is non-judgmental and who tries to find what's beautiful and unique in everyone they meet and certainly doesn't consider herself better than anybody else!! A touch of humor & wit, varied life experience, wisdom, sharing, intellect, able to truly connect, oh such important traits to offer others who also want a fulfilling life. Does this describe you? Well it does describe me, and if you would like to meet for a cocktail and find out more about these connections, and have a truly great experience that is both spontaneous and risk taking, send me your real photo and tell me a little bit about yourself. I'm a lesbian. I'm not interested in meeting couples and I'm not interested in meeting men, not even interested in meeting you if you have a boyfriend or husband ok? SorryÂ 

You can be in a place of struggle right now perhaps need a listening ear because you are heartbroken, or perhaps a safe place to vent, or you can be incredibly happy wanting to spread that around and make new friends. Either way, I will accept you and enjoy your company. If you are a person who likes to read personal ads but generally doesn't reply, perhaps you want to do that this time? LOL **smile** I have started up a gathering of single lesbians who really need and want nurturing support and friendship and just to go out and socialize and laugh together and connect. Please be between ages 40 and 55. This is a group of middle-aged women who have had relationships that last more than 6 months or a year.

I will return my photo AFTER you send yours. I honestly don't care what you look like but how beautiful you are inside. I need the photo also to make sure I am not talking with a man posing to be a woman. Hey, it's out there - trust me.

I just like to know who I'm speaking to and who I would be looking for in public - so it doesn't feel awkward. Myself, I am attractive, mid forties, feminine and in pretty good shape. I'm near the U of M area & I am an excellent matchmaker. Even though the premise of the group is not to be set up or hook up for the night, you just never know where you're going to find chemistry. Thanks

Let's do this !!!!

title: Need new things to do
text:
Hello everyone!

I am a single 29 year old male that is just kind of on the hunt for new and fun things to do in the next few months. I have been dealing with a very real recent bout of depression and I just want to meet new a fun people that I can hang out with regularly. Being almost 29 most of my old friends have all grown up and have got married or have families so I kind of got kicked back to the end of the line (which is totally cool just feels like "well, shit").

anyways, im a huge gamer, huge comic nerd, huge sci fi nerd, and... well...huge nerd in general. though I may not always look it. that being said im totally a night owl and im looking for people to hang out with in the odd night hours (im talking like START hanging out after 10pm). That's just my "primetime" so I tend to get quite lonely at that point.

Oh I should probably state im a smoker, but will refrain around you if we do hangout and its a huge issue. 420 is cool, just not my thing, and drinking is always acceptable, just not heavily!

anyways, we can email a bit and move to text and then see if we are cool enough to hang out, if you want. I am only looking for friends, and I will tell you why in the very first email if you ask me! :-)

Thanks!

title: Need new people to talk to
text:
My friends have been mostly failing me lately, so I thought I'd give this another go.
A few details, I'm 23, white, educated (have a bachelor's degree but back in school), reasonably nerdy, love music and movies. Also a pretty avid gamer, but I think that's because I don't have a ton going on in my life right now, meaning I have quite a bit of free time. Personality wise I'm mostly introverted; socially anxious, pretty shy, and overall just kind of awkward (although I've been told I'm not horrible). I've also been told I'm funny and "nice" but I don't know how accurate that is. I have been trying (and mostly failing) to be more social, so don't expect me to be a very forward person because I'm awful at that, hence turning to craigslist. I am single, but I'm not looking for a relationship but I'm also not actively avoiding them either. Also definitely not looking for a hook up or fwb type situation.
Again, just looking for new people to talk to and potentially end up meeting up with, with the simple hope of making some new friends. Don't care about things like age (within reason), body type, or race. Only thing I care about is that we share some interests and can communicate decently (so decent grammar would be appreciated). Would also probably be beneficial if you're not afraid to be a little more forward, because again, not exactly a strong suit of mine.
So if you think we might not hate each other, respond with a little bit about yourself and we can go from there. And if there is somewhere you want to start the conversation, I'm certainly open to suggestions.

Side note, also fine talking with other guys, but the M4M section doesn't exactly seem to live up to being "strictly platonic," so I'll just avoiding posting there, although I'm guessing the M4W section is no better.

title: Dissociative Identity Disorder? (Description For Females To Read)
text: Hi, thank you for reading this posting. I am in my late 40's now and just starting therapy and uncovering this stuff. Victims tend to repress the memories quite deep. We know this happens (incest by a parent, uncle, fam. friend, older siblings, etc) much more than most people can imagine. If you were abused as a child you may very well suffer from degrees of this disorder. Do you feel uneasy a lot of the time? Like you don't 'fit in'? Sometimes conflicting sexual impulses? Sometimes display a behavior that makes you feel like it's an out-of-body episode? Seeking someone who would be interested in chatting a bit and compare notes. I am gaining a full grasp of this condition and recognize past triggers. What stage of awareness are you? Childhood abuse is very traumatic to a developing young mind and brings about a lack of a single, unified identity. I wish you well and hope to hear from you. Thank You.

title: conversation + dinner,movie,coffee, drinks
text:
Hail there :D

Just because it is Craigslist and some folks get confused by the meaning of "Platonic." I am by no means interested in the physicalities a man and woman may share. I am in a committed relationship of several years and have two beautiful children! :)

If you are still here great! That said what I am looking for is a sincere time spent with someone who can carry out intelligent, non-condemning, and easy flowing conversation. :)
Other than that I don't care your age as long as you are classified as an adult, as long as you have skin I don't care how much melanin it contains, how much you weigh has nothing to do with who you are as a person by my belief, and that is how I sit with everything associated with what the eyes perceive. Not a common held stance I know ;b

Here is the hook! I am free perhaps tonight, but that is kinda short notice, Saturday, and Sunday. I would like to talk to you a little bit, so that there can be greater comfortably for when we meet and greet, as well as a degree of chemistry. Aside from friendly banter and sharing, it would be my privilege to treat you to dinner, coffee/drinks, movie, walk/outdoor chill pun intended, or other ideas you may have. Why? Because I love people, and my partner is visit her parents as she often does a few hours away whose values are for starkly different from my non-negotiatable beliefs, and therefore interact with them as infrequently as possible. I am tired of spending the weekends alone and would just like a friend to get to know. :)

Still there, awesome! Finally, little about me. I am empathetic, compassionate, erudite, cerebral, open perspective, genuine, kind, respectful, adventurous, ambitious, well humored, spontaneous, and a rebel at heart! Let's talk, get to know each other a bit and make weekend plans! :D remember my treat ;b

Will send pic/s (decent) to replies that took some time to respond with more than a sentence. Thanks for reading :)

With excitement, 

ME

title: Biking, Walking, Photography?
text:
Hi there! I appreciate you taking the time to read this. Hopefully you have an interest in some of the same things I do. Spring seems to be coming on fast and strong. I would love to get out and mix it up with someone.

First things first. I am 5'8" with short hair (some grey), about 165 pounds, glasses, and in decent shape. Actually I am on my way to being in very good shape. I look good in my bike shorts. While some may see me as average I am far from that in many ways... physical and beyond.

I am the primary care giver for my younger children. Effectively I am Mr. Mom. I would love to meet someone who might be in a similar situation for activities during the day. I can also get away in the evenings with a bit of notice.

I am more than willing to share my picture with anyone that responds with a legitimate response. Last year I tried this here on CL and met some amazing people. I have a wide variety of interests and hope to explore some of those with you soon.

I know that there are a ton of men on here scamming for sex or other things. While of course I am a sexual man that is not my main focus in trying to meet someone. I am lonely and have free time during the day. I just would like to be more active and see where things go. I have no expectations and hopefully you are open minded enough to give it a chance. My friends would describe me as super humorous and someone with a bit of wit and extremely easy going.

I have an advanced degree in music performance and can make a connection with just about anyone. If you are up for some conversation and harmless flirting ping me back. The only way to find out where it all may lead is to take that first step and message me back. I challenge you to take a peek down the rabbit hole. ;)

Polymath Jeff

title: In search of friends
text:
Hello

Life is too short to not have friends. Finding them is hard especially when you are older. I am looking to grow my male social network. It is also good for the spirit and for our health. 
I don't think CL is a cure all for this but it is worthy of a shot.
I am a 45 year old, gay guy (in a relationship) looking for other guys to hang out with. It does not matter if are married, partnered, single, straight, bi, gay or whatever. What matters is that your are cool, kind and genuine. It would be fun to go to to happy hours, going to games and concerts, hikes, biking exploring, sky diving, zip-lining, etc. I am up for most anything.
This is about hopefully making a strong connection and reinforcing it over time so that it blossoms into a friendship. If you need to know details up front like stats or whatever, I don't think this will work out. 

Heck yeah, it's nerve racking to meet a stranger, but you never know what can happen unless you take that chance, right? Join me and let's chat!

Drop me a line if you are interested and a little about you. Feel free to ask questions.
Thanks for reading!

title: Help a sinner make a friend?
text:
How do you do?

Nice to see people still read, bare with me as my spelling is horrible as well as my grammar, maybe you'll be able to understand?

The English language has roughly a million words and it takes 15 minutes to try and figure what word to use to start a sentence or for me it is at least, one of the downfalls of being a stoner.

Yep, I wasted another fifteen minutes, ahh.

We should have coffee as emailing and such is only seven percent affective when communicating, I went to a seminar, so you know I'm an expert now, lol.

So, here's the deal, I'm bad with making friends, my personality is less then stellar?

So, what I'm a smart ass and don't like things complicated.

In my early thirties, smoke cigarettes but not much of drinker, super classy, I'm aware.

Believe it or not, I help give back to the community and or society and do my fair share. (I litter )
I was kidding about the littering, btw.

Life is pretty good here, but always better to share what you have with those who are deserving.

It would be nice to spend a little less time alone, maybe you would be willing to tech me how to make a Friend or maybe you have a friend, kind of like me but not or after a Few cups of co co (or pick your poison within reason) you my want to be my friend?

let's go zip lining, I bet you will laugh at least once.

Perfuably your a sinner with some type of principle system, as I am looking for a friend and friends are for life, even if you move. Lol

This is taking significantly longer to write, than anticipated but figure it's worth the extra effort being that your reading it, :) I will be happy to repspond to those worth responding to with a picture of myself.

Enjoy the weekend, 

Bob

title: There Has To Be At Least One...That's All...Just One
text: First and foremost I will say that this post and myself are truly genuine, sincere and legit. I am truly amazed that out of all the bots, fakes, scammers & pay site women posting on Craigslist, that there is not just one legit, sincere and genuine female wanting to chat. I am an older gentleman, but most people guess my age to be much, much younger. You are age and relationship status is not an issue for me. As long as you are not a minor and I am very non judgemental. I am very honest, loyal, trustworthy, laid back and open minded. Willing to talk about anything and everything, no subject taboo. Except for maybe politics and religion. I find them to be very boring subjects and I'm already bored. I'm not looking for a one or two time conversation either. I'm hoping to find someone interested enough in making it an ongoing chat friendship. My intention is not to meet anyone but, should we find that we have that spark and or connection to take it to another level, I would never say no to a meet and greet. I guess we could cross that bridge if and when we ever get to it. I'm just looking for someone to chat the day, nights and weekends away to make life more tolerable. My life has been all work and no play lately. So, if you are that needle in the haystack of bots, fakes and scammers, I hope you'll come forward and let the chatting begin. To weed out those low lifes I mentioned earlier, in the subject line, please put..."Legit Lady". If I do not see that in the subject line, I will delete the message without even opening it. If you care to send a photo to put a face with the words, that would be nice also. So now I'm going to wait and hopefully hear from the real genuine women.

title: MARRIED WOMEN MUST BROWSE ALSO...
text:
I remember life before marriage. Before children. I remember longing for one another constantly. Just holding one another all night and nothing else in the world seemed to matter. I remember loving one another with every ounce of our being. I remember lusting for one another (at minimum) daily. I remember staring in her eyes on our first date and knowing, without a doubt, I was staring into the futute. I remember passion. 
And then the first child came. And then the rings went on our fingers. And then life began. A life filled with love for one another and our children. A life we we had both dreamed of. A life we worked so hard to attain. A life filled with frustration. A life filled with exhaustion. A life devoid of sex. A life without the expression of that passion we once shared. 
I love my wife with all of my heart. I love my children with every ounce of my being. I look in their eyes and know, without a doubt, I see the future. I see graduations, and weddings, and grandchildren. I see a life worth living. A life worth being proud of. But I miss sex. I miss (the occasional) moments of irresponsibility with minimal consequences. I miss lust. I miss the passion.
I have no idea why I posted. I have no idea what my intentions or motives are. Maybe this resonates with you? Maybe you'd like to chat? I'm never opposed to making a new friend, and I love to learn about other people and hear their stories. I guess if you'd like to chat, drop me a note. I hope you're having an awesome day!

title: A note to affectionate guys
text:
Some of us guys just need more affection than others. I think about touching and being touched a lot; usually several times a day. These fantasies are usually platonic; I can separate affection and sex needs. For some reason, I seem to need affection from men more than women. Maybe this is because of my same-sex attraction, but I don't know.

My parents almost never touched me when I was a kid. I didn't have affectionate friends either. When I was about 14, a boy in my class put his hand on my shoulder as he passed by me and said, "hello". It was an amazing experience for me. I had just discovered that I enjoy touch. I really hadn't even known what I was missing until then. I'm not sure how common my experience is.

I have done some research about touch, but there isn't much out there. I learned that children who aren't shown affection tend to either need a lot of it as adults, or they become adverse to it. The lack of touch can be very damaging to infants. Americans in general are somewhat affectionate, but there are places where showing affection is more common. Does anyone know of some good research?

I find day to day life really lacking when it comes to touch. I wish that people were more open to showing and receiving affection. I have to be careful with who I touch because some men are really uncomfortable with being touched. I take notice when a guy brushes against me. I have to wonder if he craves touch too. I will admit to subtly touching a guy like that many times. When I ride the bus, or I'm at a movie I wonder if I will be next to a guy that will let his leg touch mine. This is very stressful. If I allow my leg to touch his, will he quickly pull away? Will I make him uncomfortable, or will he appreciate the contact too? I'm sure that some guys hardly notice the touch; they neither like nor dislike it. If the guy seems to like the touch, I will move my leg up and down very slightly once or twice. If he does the same, it is great! If this causes him to pull away, I feel guilty for invading his space.

I studied massage therapy and worked in the field for a while. This became draining for me; I gave touch, but I rarely got any back. Not that I was expecting to be touched, I just didn't know that it would be so difficult to give and not get any touch back. It reminded me of how much I wanted to receive touch.

After I've interacted with a man several times (like at work, for example), sometimes I put my hand on his shoulder for moment. I hope that he will reciprocate later, but usually he doesn't. I never want to be pushy because I know that some guys are really uncomfortable with being touched.

I was with a guy from work last night at my place. We had good conversation, not just the usual superficial type. I felt a little lonely though because we had no physical contact. For me, good conversation with no physical contact can be lonely. I asked him if he was okay with hugging each other. He thought it was odd that I asked, but he was fine with it, and he gave me a nice hug. I think it's interesting that we have worked together for two years or so, and he never touched me until last night. We probably shook hands when we first met, but that was about it. When I was a teenager working my first job, several guys were very affectionate with me. As time goes on, it is harder and harder to find men like this.

People are very affectionate with pets; it seems that a lot of people would rather get affection needs met with a pet. I'm sure that many dogs get much more affection than I do! This is sad. Pets really do little for me. We had dogs when I was younger, but I never felt really close to them.

Sometimes I go for weeks with little affection. This really wears on me. I deal with depression, and I know that some touch would help. Affection is a great stress reliever too.

I was hoping to find some men that relate and share some thoughts with me. I'm very comfortable with meeting if there is a good connection. I hate texting, and emailing isn't much better. I'm good with talking on the phone at first, but I prefer meeting in person.

I'm a very nice guy, sensitive, down-to-earth, respectful, intelligent, very honest and introverted. I like meeting all kinds of nice people. Making new friends would be nice. I especially like real friends that don't mind helping each other (even working) when needed. However, I don't have a specific agenda. If you just want to talk about something, I'm open to that too. There doesn't have to be any physical attraction between us for us to be platonic friends, and I'm not going to refuse to meet someone just because I feel no physical attraction. If this is important to you, say so up front. Otherwise we may spend time together only for both of us to be frustrated later. I hug people that I'm not physically attracted, but it would be difficult to cuddle with someone that I wasn't physically attracted to. So, if you care, I'm 6-2, bearded, brown/gray hair, leaner than average, young-looking for my age, and handsome (your opinion may vary). I'm mostly attracted to guys around my age or younger. Again, it's more about the person inside than what's on the outside.

Keywords describing me, likes, etc: trustworthy, caring, fitness, floral design, atheist, respectful, long walks, deep conversation, hugs, personal growth, volunteerism, gardening, quietness, reflection, and lots more.

When responding, please include a pic and something about yourself. Also, let me know what you want. I will share a recent pic too. Also, change the subject line in the email. Yahoo emails end up getting grouped together by subject, and it can get very confusing.

One more thing. There are men on here that post ads, and they clearly aren't interested in platonic friends. Please help to clean these ads out. Open the ad and click on the "prohibited" link at the top. If several people do this, the ad is removed. Thanks. I hope to hear from you!

title: Wanted: Pretend GF/Fling
text:
After reading ad after ad on Craig's List about individuals seeking to find a relationship offering meaning, contentment, or an opportunity to be spanked by a dominant transgender nun, I have decided that all I really want right now is a pretend relationship or virtual "fling."

The benefits of a pretend relationship/fling, lie in being able to communicate (via email only) with another individual about things that are not actually occurring in one's life. It's the incredible chance to be completely dishonest with another individual who wants nothing more than a beautiful pretend connection with another soul.

We needn't share photos, real names, or accurate personal data. I will never ask you to call me, meet me, or send me your bank account routing number to help a deposed Nigerian dictator who will pay you back in millions. I just want to have a deep, intense relationship that has no actual roots in reality.

To be my pretend girlfriend/fling, you must be exceedingly intelligent, articulate and edgy. Your sense of humor must be phenomenal -- I would never pretend date someone who was not incredibly funny. You should be quite beautiful with striking features, (though I will never really know if it's true). It's essential that your mastery of English includes proper spelling. I will pretend break-up with you in a heartbeat if you make lots of typos. That's a major turn off...

I am, of course with this being pretend, a really bright, very good looking physician, who is coming off of a very painful, faux break up, so I might be pretend rebounding right now.

Potential pretend girlfriends/flings please note: I will not respond to any replies that include photos of your penis. (I don't expect any such replies, but it seems like that's what everyone writes at the end of their ads...)

title: Work Out Partner?
text:
Hey there Ladies!

Okay, I realize this request is extremely specific and maybe a little unorthodox, but what the hell, it's Craigslist...right?

The short version: I love working out, I am big into fitness and neither my wife (yes, I said wife) nor my friends share this passion. The adrenaline, the feeling of accomplishment and the excitement that this part of my life brings out needs to be celebrated, it wants to be fueled by someone else with similar goals and experiences. My wife and friends do not understand and frankly don't want to talk about it. I guess I am kind of looking for a BFF (best fitness friend). Someone to help push me, someone I help to push. Share successes, failures and someone to keep each other on track! Maybe we work out together, maybe we just root each other on, maybe someone to say "get out of bed and get your ass to work!!!". I think these feelings and these experiences need to be shared and celebrated and what better than someone experiencing the same thing, maybe needing a little help and just excited about being healthy???

So, why am I looking for a woman you ask? Well, let me say this up front. I am looking for nothing besides a BFF and this is a totally innocent platonic post, however, working out and fitness comes with some excitement and tension I thought I could be exciting to share this with someone that these feelings could simmer a bit. Because this is innocent, I don't care if you are married, single, engaged...whatever. Just looking for someone who shares my passion and maybe looking for a partner to share it with.

I don't need to share pics, but am far from afraid too if you are interested. Let's start with talking about our goals, our routines and maybe try to help each other on where to go. Maybe we email each other just once and we move on with some good ideas, or maybe we text every day helping push each other to the next level and maybe even work out together. Cardio, lifting, intense, laid back, I am open to anything. 

If any of this sounds like something interesting, send me a line and let's chat?

Thanks!!!

title: flirting and coffee ONLY meetings.
text:
It is nice to be appreciated and see that twinkle in the eye...isn't it? Or am I alone in this thought? 

Would be nice to share coffee and conversations with a special lady and see that twinkle...again. 

Being just 'friends' allows for the conversation to be broader and in many ways more fulfilling. Outright sex tends to inhibit things. Strange but true. 

It is nice to just appreciate someone without going any farther. What can I say....I must be easily amused? Maybe not though. There is something very full filling with not getting what you THINK you want and finding that not getting what you want opens up ways of feeling and appreciating what you do have or think about. It is kind of like looking at the chocolate bar...Yum.....Okay....now go ahead .....savor ...unwrap ....hold in your hand...then mouth....slowly....let it melt and feel that huge overwhelming sense of chocolate heaven? Sure you did and a hersheys (let's be patriotic) wasn't even in sight! Ahem.....are you connecting the dots? Yup....same can be done with 'whoopie'. 

My ideal box of chocolates looks and acts (you know chocolate comes in all sorts of sizes and shapes and personas....bunny rabbits.....and god knows what else!) is as follows:

She is pretty smart, brainy, a reader/bookworm. Young 20's ...30's. Brunette. Brown eyes. Pretty face. Fair complexion. NOT SKINNY. On the plump or more side. You like to use clothes to set off your feminine ways. And can say a lot with just her...eyes.

Okay fair is fair. 50, but young 50, WM, overly educated, very nice attractive appearance. Tall, blue eyed, nice skin, teeth, hands, etc. I am very well domesticated ( I bet that might be part of the problem?). Medium build and super clean and safe. I mean I would make Howard Hughes look dirty! Now there I just really dated myself. 

Do you like to flirt and be appreciated for all of you and keep your clothes on, too? Get that warm buzz feeling from head to toe? Be on the edge of your seat just alittle and enjoy getting alittle extra attention for YOU....not for some magic you perform in your daily life.....you know....for the boss or customer....or family.....that was a great sale....you performed that well...nice dinner and love your apple pie. All that is nice but are YOU a sale? A tax collection unit? An apple pie? 

Come on you know what I am talking about. It is pretty basic...human ...need. Or am I alone in this feeling?

Hope not.

Enjoy the Spring. And remember...it's later than you think!

title: Copilot wanted (no experience required)
text:
I'm looking for someone to join me on the occasional cross country flight while I'm shopping for my next plane. My current plane is a 1967 Piper Cherokee 140. It's a small 4 seat airplane nothing fancy (see picture).

The trip will vary depending on where the plane is. For example, I saw one in the Chicago area, the way there was about 3 hours 20 minutes. The trip back took just under 5 hours and I stopped part way for lunch. The trip could have been longer or shorter each way depending on headwinds. 

I'm looking for someone that enjoys flying in small planes and likes to talk about whatever. I'm planning on overnight stays, not looking for sex, just company. 

Weight does matter for aircraft limitations (and size those things are pretty small inside) but there is room for 4 total so if you have a friend or two that wants to come along they would be welcome. Combined passengers must weigh total 350 pounds or less. I can land at nearly any airport to pick you up on my way. 

Notes- I'm not leaving anyone anywhere, not a taxi service, not picking anyone up. No alcohol, drugs or smoking must be clean in general. 

About me, I'm 34 nearly divorced (it's complicated) with 2 wonderful kids ages 10 and 12. I work nights on the weekends and have 4 days off each week. I love flying, and the outdoors, lots of other things we can talk about too. 

Texting is awesome@ 2one8-eight31-seven122 my name is Derek send 'Copilot' so I know you are people. 

P.S. If you can't make a flight like this happen, I fly into Duluth a lot in the evenings (usually pretty late) that might be another option. If you think this sort of thing sounds fun feel free to text me and maybe we'll be able to meet up some time to fly somewhere.

I'm hoping to find someone who is open-minded, non-judgmental, and someone who will put a decent amount of effort into the friendship, someone who at least values positivity even if they don't always hit the mark. A bit about myself and my interests, just so you can know if we'd have things in common.
* I like metal! Especially symphonic metals bands along the lines of Nightwish, but lots of others as well.

title: openminded, mindful guy
text:
I've met a couple good friends off of the strictly platonic section of craigslist before, but haven't posted here in years. Randomly seemed like a good idea today. It would be great to meet someone who is cut from a similar cloth.

The mindful and openminded parts come from having Buddhist tendencies. I'm trying to live intentionally and spiritually is becoming more important to me as I get older. I'm also trying not to take myself too seriously. 

Other than that I'm a rather slender lad with long hair who has a myriad of interests. I look quite young for my age. I'm very sarcastic at times and love to laugh. I'm a student in the helping fields, which requires a great deal of tact and genuineness (and the accepting of suffering in life), but I have the skill of bringing humor to serious situations too. I'm compassionate, gentle, open-minded, very autonomous but supportive to people I let into my life. I like reading, fixing cars, sometimes brewing wine, meditating, and things done in nature. Right now my life is quiet busy with school, internship, and work, but in my spare time I like going out to see live music (primarily alternative rock, but open-minded), meeting people to talk over beers or tea, or otherwise finding entertaining ways to fart around. I don't like to put people in boxes, and don't like being put into a box by others.

title: That one neighbor
text:
You know who I am talking about, that cute guy from down the street. The one who you see outside with his kids and always seem to notice when he passes by. The reason you take a little longer to get ready when you might see him at a neighborhood party. The guy who you always seem to lock eyes with slightly longer than you should.

Acting on those feelings could really make things complicated though. You are friends with his other half even though you know she doesn't make him happy. The rest of your neighbors are amazing and you really don't want to risk the gossip. The whole situation has the potential of turning in to one big mess.

Funny thing is, I bet there are situations like this in every neighborhood. I know there are a few in mine. Maybe the solution is to find someone in a neighborhood a little further away instead. Could be interesting to see what might happen...

title: Lonely but not alone
text:
About whom I am. I am 53 years old, brown eyes, salt/pepper hair. I am 5'9" tall in good shape, I am muscular, but could use a little more weight, just my opinion. I have been told that I am a good looking man, maybe, I don't know. I had been married to the same women for 27 years until she passed away in 2006. My wife and I had 2 Sons, Ron and Mike. The kids were born 3 years apart, Ron being the oldest. Ron passed away in 1989 at the age of 6 years, his brother Mike followed him and passed away in 1981 at the age of six years old. My wife and I adopted a little boy at birth, David; he is 17 years old and now lives with his biological mother. I have been a widow since 2006 but since then live with a women that I love, but that love is no longer returned to me as she is seeing other (Men), that is plural. Knowing this I can not stay in a relationship with a woman that has destroyed trust and will not return love, I really believe that she is incapable of this. I have never cheated on my wife, and never cheated with who I am with now. But I do find myself lonely and needing to reach out and find life again.
I have always been a hard working man. I consider myself Honest, compassionate, caring, sympathetic, giving, and as my wife once had said to me that I was selfless. I do have a sense of humor, like to smile and laugh. I am driven, meaning that when I am put to task I tend to complete it no matter how difficult it can become.
I am looking for a Woman with the same traits that I have. Honesty, trust, and communication are very important to me and I look for these qualities in any future relationship I may have. I am looking for a woman who is a little strong willed, can hold her own with a little sarcasm on the side. This woman should feel comfortable in her own skin as well and feel good about herself. The Women I am looking for should be comfortable in jeans, and then feel just as good dressing up to go out, whether that be out to a club, dinner or formal outing. I am non judgmental and she should be as well, and this also holds true when she looks in the mirror at herself This Women that I have described here would complete me as I would hope that I would complete her has well. I believe that when the individual genders come together in a relationship such as I described, they become a whole new separate being, a being with two half's that complete the other.
I know that might have been a little long winded, please don't look at this any other way but trying to give you a complete picture of who this Man is, and please don't take this as a sign of weakness or desperation.
I hope that this has help you a little to understand this guy at the other end of the keyboard. I wish you well in everything you do and seek out. 

- Ron

title: Getting to know someone new. Pen-pal, email friends

Hello!

First off I am 29, very happily married, and would never change or hurt that, but I really enjoy getting to know new people, that are okay keeping it platonic, or risking any harm to anyone's relationship. I am also from Texas, and enjoy getting to know people from other areas as it removes the pressure to meet if there is a connection, and keep relationships safe.

I work from home most days, which also means I don't do much on those days, and it would be great to have someone new to get to know and share things with. I'm very open minded, goofy, extremely laid back, I don't judge, I'm allergic to drama, I can be really sarcastic but I know when to turn it off, easy to talk to, and I've had an interesting and unique life so far, so I think I have quite a few interesting things/stories to share. I also have a bit of a dirty mind, and might throw a "that's what she said" into a conversation at some point. I am also a major night owl, so if you are too, even better!

I am looking for someone who is: intelligent, funny, witty, understands sarcasm, open minded, non-judgemental, dirty minded, drama free (although venting is allowed), easy to talk with, and just fun.

Again not looking to meet or change anyone's relationship, just looking for fun conversations to get through the day or night.

Hope you are having a great day and I'm looking forward to chatting with you!

title: Literate, long-term connection
text:
Over the years, I've had a couple of very pleasant extended interactions with women I've met via Craigslist. As you might imagine, this hasn't come easily. I've posted quite a few times, and most of the responses have been somehow off the mark. Sometimes respondents have been looking for a different kind of interaction; many times there has been a simple lack of chemistry; and, because it's CL, frequently the problem has been sheer lunacy on the part of the respondent.

With that history in mind, I think I can do a better job of articulating what I'm looking for and which type of woman might be the best fit for me in this endeavor. Please note: I'm not offering any kind of authoritative global commentary on what's "right" or "good" here; I'm merely stating what works for me -- an admittedly imperfect person. I respect the fact that it might not appeal to everyone, but I'm probably not interested in having an extended argument about how misguided or unfair I am. 

First, a little about me: I am an academic in my late 40s. I'm married and have a couple of kids. I am generally content with this situation. Truth be told, I'm not desperately unhappy. However, I find myself somewhat restless, and looking for sustained connections online. My goal in doing this isn't to engage in a torrid physical affair (more on that later) but rather to find steady electronic interaction (mainly via email) with someone who stimulates me intellectually, emotionally, and physically. Only one or two email per day probably won't be sufficient to hold my interest. And -- despite the length of this posting -- I'm usually not someone who writes a short essay with each response. I'm looking for short but fairly steady contact (knowing, of course, that sometimes life gets in the way and one can't always respond immediately).

My partners in this kind of interaction invariably have been younger -- usually women in the 32-40 age range. I am not sure why this is --honestly I'm not obsessed with the idea of connecting with a "younger woman" -- but I have found it to be comfortable. Also, they have been reasonably well educated and engaged in professional careers. (No, I won't be expecting to see a resume, but there will be more common ground with someone in a white collar occupation.) I'm a fit, active person, and I'd prefer someone who is similarly inclined (runner, yogi practitioner, etc.), or at least fits into the "HWP" category. There are some other characteristics that I value, but they seem rather generic and subjective: sense of humor, literacy, taste in music, books, wine, etc. 

Finally, regarding the possibility of meeting in person: It's not my primary goal. Furthermore, I'm posting this ad outside the area where I actually reside, so it would be extremely difficult to pull off. However, with the right person and under the perfect set of circumstances, I would entertain the possibility.

But first, let's email.

title: Montana boy seeks sane, active tour guide
text:
Cold, clear, calm autumn mornings lately. The weather pattern has been consistent. High pressure. The temp seems to hover right around 35 degrees F at dawn. Balmy. The sky twinkles with retreating stars and glows with pinks, purples, the warmer yellows of a sluggish sun on a jagged horizon. I'm out the door for work around 8am. That glowing ball has finally climbed its way above the foothills and I'm headed to town, West, with the low sun at my back, East. It's cold so full gear. Heavier gloves, heavy jeans, riding jacket with some protection for the back, shoulders, arms. This gives me a sense of false confidence. This is exactly what I do not need. I wear running shoes because it's easy to feel the shift lever and they are comfortable. The shoes are mesh and it feels cool when the wind blows through them. I gain speed, check mirrors, am blinded by the bright reflection of a beautiful sunrise behind me. Visor is up through sixth gear, the wind whistles around and through my helmet. Instantly awake. My eyes water. The visor goes down and I twist the wrist. 70 mph into town. 

It takes about a minute to get to the outskirts. 40 mph, 25 through old town, East Main, down through the gears and into second. I glance at the display. Tach-ing 4,000RPM's, engine temp is where it should be at 175 degrees. I note that the engine sounds great but there is a subtle rattle coming from a section of fairing. It's sleepy in town, not much traffic. I need to go to the bank on Main to deposit a check. Usually I go inside but it's too early for the lobby to be open so the drive thru it is. No one is there. I pull up, kick the stand, hop off, rummage through the backpack, start talking to the teller. She's really nice, and she's really cute. I notice after about 10 minutes of random conversation about our respective lives that she is really easy to talk to, that I don't have the $60 in cash I asked for, she still has my debit card, receipt, etc. Finding this comical, we both laugh at the situation as it unfolds. She's a bored teller from Boston. She's curious why I'm not in the slightest hurry to get to work like everyone else. She's beaming. That's what tellers do, right? We share a weird connection but I'm outside in full motorcycle gear leaning against a pole, shivering, wondering where all my shit is, and she's a beautiful woman dressed up in a glass booth. 

A van pulls up and she is forced to do her job. We say our goodbyes. She asks me if I want a lolly-pop for the road. They call them suckers here. Maybe there too? I told her no, I would probably crash and I just brushed my teeth anyway. She tells me that she's there all day if I change my mind. I laugh, thank her, start the bike. It revs high because the engine is cool. I make a quick left out of the bank and a right onto Main. Second gear, third gear. 40 mph. Buzzing to work with Thursday morning coffee smells in the air I'm thinking that my fingers are cold and it's getting harder to pull the clutch. Involuntarily I tilt over to grab my butt for a wallet check. I notice the heat of the sun on my back. It feels good. The maples around town are in full color. It's a beautiful morning. 

A light turns red and I stop. Samantha comes to mind and I think that I never even thought to ask her out. Not once. 

I'm just a simple guy here in Montana. Eyeing your area and will be exploring it eventually. Looking for someone to start some sort of dialogue with. Maybe words, maybe pictures, maybe some combination? 

I love people. But as a super-sweet "pen pal" and friend preferably you would be of a similar age, you would be sane, educated, empathetic, and able to write effectively. Ideally you're engaged in your community, you're active, you're in shape, you're petite, you're healthy, and you don't spend hours every day staring at your cell phone. 

Copious bonus points if you ride bicycles or if you're a 420 girl or if you're a hockey girl or if you write more than two sentences or if you don't send me something from your iPhone while you're stuck in traffic.

Do you exist? Write to me. Tell me a story.

text:
I was recently informed that there are a couple of nudist clubs just a short drive from St Paul. I've always been interested in going clothes free for a day, or a full weekend if all goes well. I'm a little bit shy about getting naked. My breasts are huge, and I have the ass to match. I'm worried that people will be judging me. I've read that most nudist club members are pretty judge free, but it'll always be at the back of my mind. To help counter this I'd like to spend the day, or weekend at the nudist club, with a couple whose female has the same/similar physical attributes as myself. I guess I'd even be open to just go with another female with similar features. As of today, Super Bowl Sumday, I'm single, but hope to be attached by the time when it'll be warm enough to have to pack nothing more than a towel for a weekend getaway. 

So, if you're a nudist couple, or even just interested in checking out a nudist club this summer, whose female 1/2 is a BBW, or you're a single BBW nudist, change the subject line in your email to whoever you think today's winner will be, and tell me a little bit about yourselves. Happy Super Bowl Sunday! (Please no single guys. True, I am single, but I've got my eye on someone)

title: Mother or Big Sister type figure
text:
I'm 23 and my depression is quit bad right now.
I've always have been a loner, but my social circle is down to nothing
now. As much as I want to be with people, it's a frightening and at times
impossible thing to do.
I'm looking for someone who get's that. Who know's some days are worse
than most. I still live at home. I'm not able to work much.
Lot's of times the medicine does more harm than anything else.
Now I have a mom and Dad, and everything's as dis-functionally fine as it 
can be.
But I want some who isn't family. I'd like someone older than me.
Who has wisdom. I'm not looking for sex or romance. 
I want to be close to you, to confide and laugh. To be friends but
more of that mother-son, or big sister-little brother, and the conventional peer friendship.
I'd like to email at first. Maybe talk on the phone. And hopefully we could spend time
together when I'm doing a little better. I was thinking meeting for lunch sometimes,
things like that.
This is by no means a requirement, but I was thinking you to be in the age
range of 40 to 60.
You can be married, single partnered, lesbian, or an alien. None of that matters
since this isn't about sex.

title: So many wonderful, thoughtful women
text:
I sometimes read about all the psychos, crazies, lunatics, liars, etc. ... that inhabit this board.

I just want to say that my experience has been far from this. I have found a number of women to be very intelligent and thoughtful in what they write. Some have had amazing life experiences that have given me new perspectives on things.

Many are able to deal with the complexities of life. Life is not simple, nor are there easy answers ... we are all here for different reasons and cannot be lumped into simple categories. Some see past age, politics, and religion and can try to understand other's as individuals. 

Many are kind and compassionate. They have offered me words of encouragement at hard times. 

I have been fortunate to meet in person with many and they are often great conversationalists and quick to listen. 

So thank you to all the women that act with respect here and challenge the notion that people on the CL boards must be a little crazy.

title: Married for married
text:
Hello!

I used to be a fun guy -- I was out on Thursday/Friday nights, doing outdoors over the weekend, had a small but tight group of friends, watched movies, went to the concerts, road trips, camping, etc. etc. Then I married my girl (believing that the third long relationship must work), had a couple of kids, friends moved on, got promoted at work -- and now, I am an overworked, sleep deprived married man, trying to find balance between home and work life while trying to make everyone happy. My marriage has drifted into rough waters (and future doesn't look too bright -- but we are not giving up and keep fighting to save it), at work I am in that middle management role -not high enough to make the decisions and not powerful enough to get it done through my team either. 

Basically, life sucks right now and I don't want to just bitch about it. I would like to find a special 'friend' to talk to -- first via emails and eventually in person. My first thought was trying to talk to women at the gym or in grocery stores and I realized that's not a very bright idea - may have worked when I was single/younger but I don't have a good game anymore. My second thought was a friend's wife who is very touchy feely towards me when drunk but as much as I enjoy the fantasy, I know it is a really really bad idea and will certainly lead to big trouble. So, here I am on Craigslist. I responded to a few ads and didn't get a response (I am not going to attach a pic in my first email). 

Writing is not my forte and certainly not this type of writing. I read some other posts in men for women section and while I am no different from others in my search (married men looking for women to email or have affairs with), I don't think I quite belong here and this is likely as bad an idea as hoping to talk to women at the grocery store. Otherwise too, I know I am likely coming across a complainer and negative person (which I am actually not). 

Oh, the customary info on who am I -- I am 36, married, engineer, . . . as for how I look etc. it will be easier to just exchange pics (if someone responds and we get that far). You are 30-40, married, professional/educated, . . . open minded for this sort of thing :-)

title: Busy professional seeking extra muse
text:
OK -- This ad is not for everyone and I admit, I am bad and I probably shouldn't be around here looking for women. I am married to a funny and beautiful woman, have two little kids, a decent job. . .life is good except I have a habit of wanting more. With the kids and busy life, there is not much time for intimacy at home and we always seem tired. Yes, I am trying to get the spark back at home but it is an uphill battle. I have been on and off CL for over a year and exchanged emails with a number of women -- I have been a confidant, a virtual lover/fuck body, a friend. . .but avoided meeting so far -- felt too much risk to my marriage. Well, there were barriers too -- either they lived an hour or more from me or some just wanted to keep it virtual. 

Now, I am back here hoping to find someone like-minded who would be willing to venture into more than an email fling. I am 39, hwp, 5'9" -- 175 lbs. If you ever thought of cheating but were concerned about other things (risk to marriage, discretion, disease,...), I am the type of guy you want! I am posting this on platonic and not casual encounter section, because I want women like me who are like me (bad and may have cheated here and there before) and maybe looking for something long-term. 

Are you educated, smart, attractive, health conscious, 30-50 year old who may be interested in a secret lover? Tell me a bit about yourself, what part of the town do you live and let's explore.

title: Ground Hog Day
text:
I'm guessing that you are familiar with the classic Bill Murray film, "Ground Hog Day." 

I often feel that my life parallels the premise of the movie. I feel as if everyday is the same. As if a monotonous cycle simply happens over and over. Wash ... rinse ... repeat ...

Don't get me wrong, my life is wonderful in many aspects. It just lacks ... well ... I guess it lacks a sense of adventure. 

I am married and not looking to change that. I am financially stable, handsome, responsible, respectful, a great conversationalist, compassionate and an attentive listener.

I'm looking for someone in a similar position. You're cute, responsible, intelligent and have a lot going for you. Yet, you need more adventure. You're not looking for an "affair", but you do want to feel something inside your soul that has been missing. 

You are not looking for "Mr. Right" and certainly don't want to hurt those close to you, but you do want more than simply an email pal.

If you also feel that you are stuck in the Ground Hog Day cycle ... let's see if we can break out together.

title: Can I interest you in a deal?
text:
O.K., here's the deal: I've determined that what women and men who are on this site - and particularly this category - are looking for two distinctly different things. Both are looking for the same thing, however: something that they are missing at home. Women are looking for lost conversation. We all know that as married life goes on, we tend to grow apart. Fact. Conversation gets more and more rare. Down to the bare-bones minimum to get by. It seems that women miss the day-to-day conversation that they once had from their partners - whether it be a husband or even a boyfriend. Your daily "how was your day?" and "what are your dreams for the future?" Am I right??? Women are just looking for someone they can chat about anything with; a true friend. Now, the flip side. Men. Men are also looking for what is gone in their relationship. Now once again, I am talking about the "strictly platonic" section and NOT the "casual encounter" section. Men who are truly looking for a "hook-up", sex, nsa, etc. are (should be!) posting/replying from the casual encounter section. I'm talking about men who are missing the sexy - NOT sex - side of things. Men here are looking for a woman to tease them, talk sexy, talk dirty, flirty, and fun. HOPING for some sexy pictures. Maybe even some real naughty ones. But NOT looking for a hook-up. And yes, I am one of those men. I want to ask you what panties you are wearing. I want to ask you questions about sex. What you like, what you don't like. What turns you on, what turns you off. So, with all THAT being said, here's what I propose to you: I'll give you what you want if you give me what I want. As you may have noticed, I can compose a sentence. I am intelligent, articulate, witty, sarcastic (in a fun way), playful, professional, and willing to engage. I can hold my end of a conversation; meaning I can both answer questions and ask them. You MUST be able to ask your own questions as well. Please re-read that last sentence. You will not get any "one line" responses from me. I am more than able to give you insights from a man's perspective on any subject. I - much like everyone else - have an opinion on everything! However, I also realize that my opinions are just that: my opinions. I am a firm believer in the saying "Opinions are like assholes: everyone has one, and no one cares about anyone else's". I am fairly non-judgemental. I would be more than happy to have sincere, everyday day-to-day conversation (what YOU need). In return, can you give me what I seek? Are you able to hold up your end of a conversation? Are you able to ASK YOUR OWN QUESTIONS?! Are YOU intelligent, articulate, witty, sarcastic (not mandatory!), playful, professional, and willing to engage? And, willing to include some photos? AND, willing to include some PHOTOS?! ;-)

I am a 49yo married white male. I am mostly looking for conversation via e-mail during the work-day to help my work days go by quicker. I sit in front of a computer all day. Maybe some evenings, too. If it should get to that...

I may be unhappy with my relationship, but I am NOT looking to change it in the near future.

If any of this sounds the slightest bit interesting to you, please send me a line...

I would love to hear from you.

Thank you for taking the time to read this entire ad!

Bill

title: an addition to the list
text:
So I'm home for the day. The place is quiet and I'm trying to decide what to do with my rare empty afternoon. Read? Work? Watch porn? Space out on YouTube? 
I can hear the highway in the distance, through the partially open sliding door. Other than the noise of it the day is extremely quiet and still. I might walk down to the river and watch the swans. 

So why am I here? What am I looking for? Shall I list a series of qualifications for you? Maybe some conversation starters? I suppose I could. Then we can talk about how you like this and I like that. Maybe it works but I've never experienced it. I could pour my heart out right here in an attempt to appeal to your sympathies but that's just silly. 

The reality is simple. This ad will soon be buried alive by the constant flow of ads posted by desperate guys on this site. It's all rather hopeless and depressing. 

I'll keep it simple to wrap this up. I'm not going to make any declarative statements here or put qualifications on anything. Maybe you're just bored. Maybe you resemble some giant lonely iceberg far out in the vast ocean, only a small part of you extending above the surface to be viewed by the world while the expansive unseen bulk of your true self remains hidden in darkness far beneath the surface. 

"I am beyond their timid, lying morality, and so I am beyond caring."
